items.title: Weer complimenten voor Bar√ßa-doelman: 'Hij is de beste ter wereld'
items.summary: Zo overtuigend als in El Cl√°sico ging het niet, maar Barcelona is in tegenstelling tot aartsrivaal Real Madrid wel weer een ronde verder in de Copa del Rey. Dat doelman Joan Garc√≠a de complimenten kreeg na de moeizame zege op Racing Santander zegt genoeg, maar doet ook weer weinig af aan de knappe zegereeks van elf duels.

items.title: AZ vandaag de koker in voor loting tussenronde Conference League
items.summary: AZ speelt op 19 en 26 februari in de tussenronde van de Conference League. De ploeg van Maarten Martens viel net buiten de topacht, waardoor er eerst een tweeluik moet worden gewonnen om naar de achtste finale te gaan. Voetbal International legt uit wanneer de loting voor de tussenronde is.

items.title: Danish star Rune: Tennis has become unnecessarily demanding
items.summary: Holger Rune has hit out at tennis' money-makers, calling for "adjustments in the scheduling" and labelled the expanded Masters 1000 events as unnecessarily demanding..

items.title: Win or bust? Under-pressure Spurs boss Frank faces crunch West Ham clash
items.summary: Thomas Frank faces the most pivotal game of his Tottenham tenure on Saturday.

items.title: Streuer verbaast zich over Vitesse: 'Niet raar als ze komen'
items.summary: Jan Streuer (74) stopt na dit seizoen als technisch directeur van FC Twente. Een definitief afscheid van het voetbal is onwaarschijnlijk.

items.title: 'We are going to be trailing rivals' - Red Bull admit ahead of 2026 F1 season
items.summary: Red Bull chief Laurent Mekies has admitted he expects the team "to be trailing" their front-running rivals at the start of the 2026 Formula 1 season.

items.title: Steijn trekt pijnlijke conclusie na bekeruitschakeling Sparta
items.summary: Maurice Steijn vindt dat het donderdagavond bij Sparta Rotterdam ontbrak aan de echte wil om te winnen. Die pijnlijke conclusie trok de Haagse trainer na de uitschakeling in het KNVB-bekertoernooi tegen FC Volendam.

items.title: Timber en de strijd om plek twee met Feyenoord: 'Daar spelen we niet voor'
items.summary: Quinten Timber beleeft niet de beste weken met Feyenoord. Een landstitel is ver weg. De middenvelder blikt terug op de eerste seizoenshelft en praat over de strijd om de tweede plaats, die een rechtstreeks Champions League-ticket oplevert.

items.title: Carrick 'right choice at this moment' - Rooney
items.summary: Wayne Rooney says caretaker head coach Michael Carrick is the "right choice at this moment in time" to "steady the ship" at Manchester United.

items.title: British teen Lindblad hails 'surreal moment' as Racing Bulls reveal 2026 livery
items.summary: British teenager Arvid Lindblad hailed a "surreal moment" as the rookie's Racing Bulls team revealed their livery for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

items.title: Back to blue! Red Bull reveal throwback livery for 2026 F1 season
items.summary: Red Bull revealed a throwback blue livery for the 2026 Formula 1 season as the team ushered in a new era at their launch event in Detroit.

items.title: 'Head coach' vs. 'manager': What's the difference? Does it matter?
items.summary: Who would be a football manager? As it turns out in the Premier League, an increasing number of head coaches. Just ask Enzo Maresca and Ruben Amorim.

items.title: Why did Man United, Chelsea, Real Madrid all sack their managers? It's about culture
items.summary: Why have three of the biggest soccer teams in the world fired their managers in the span of just 12 days?

items.title: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend
items.summary: Chelsea need to avoid long-throw blues, plus: a vacant spot for Liverpool and West Ham‚Äôs best hope for survival Race for the golden boot: Premier League top scorers Can the 198th derby be any spicier for Manchester United and their latest interim manager, Michael Carrick? This is his second caretaker tenure though the three games of November-December 2021 (beating Villarreal and Arsenal, drawing with Chelsea) hardly compares to sending out an XI to try to beat Manchester City in Saturday‚Äôs early kick-off. Pep Guardiola‚Äôs high-performing unit remain in contention on all fronts. Carrick takes charge of a United suffering the aftershocks of a latest manager sacking, hoping to salvage the season via European qualification. The lad from Wallsend has 17 games to do so ‚Äì his new team are in seventh place on 32 points, so victory over City would be a fine start. But you wonder if the match might end with Carrick and United humbled or, even worse, humiliated. Jamie Jackson Manchester United v Manchester City, Saturday 12.30pm (all times GMT) Chelsea v Brentford, Saturday 3pm Leeds v Fulham, Saturday 3pm Liverpool v Burnley, Saturday 3pm Continue reading...

items.title: Man Utd's Mart√≠nez: Wanted to quit after ACL tear
items.summary: Manchester United defender Lisandro Mart√≠nez has revealed that during the darkest moments of his recovery from a torn ACL, he seriously considered walking away from football.

items.title: Pulisic stays on bench as Rabiot inspires Milan win
items.summary: AC Milan won 3-1 at in-form Como on Thursday, with Adrien Rabiot winning a penalty and then scoring two goals.

items.title: Mexico calls up dual-nationals Ledezma, Guti√©rrez
items.summary: United States-Mexico dual-nationals Richard Ledezma and Brian Guti√©rrez earned their first call-ups for Mexico's senior national team on Thursday ahead of non-FIFA date friendlies against Panama on Jan. 22 and Bolivia on Jan 25.

items.title: Geopolitical football: Iran? Trump? How the game can stand strong in a fractured world
items.summary: The 2026 World Cup is set to be a polarising event but, even if it will not be the first to be politically contentious, it will expose a growing unease Five months out from the World Cup the politics are impossible to avoid. There are concerns relating to one of the host countries, the US, with armed immigration officials roaming through its cities and visa restrictions stepped up against foreign visitors. One qualifying nation, Iran, is experiencing a public uprising against its leadership, with the regime attacking its citizens in response. Among other qualifiers there are concerns over democratic backsliding in Tunisia, ecological crimes in Ecuador and , in the future host country Saudi Arabia. And that‚Äôs just for starters. It sometimes feels as if this summer‚Äôs tournament, the one Gianni Infantino recently described as ‚Äúthe greatest show ever on planet Earth‚Äù, will serve as an inescapable reminder of the depressing state of the world in 2026. It could yet be an event that goes down in infamy. But it is hardly the only tournament to have prompted ethical concerns and serves as a reminder that the issue of how global sport should engage with such issues has remained largely unresolved. Continue reading...

items.title: Players need social skills for World Cup - Tuchel
items.summary: England manager Thomas Tuchel says players will need the right "social skills" and personality to make his World Cup squad.

items.title: Inquiry launched after Chelsea fans complain about policing at end of Charlton game
items.summary: Fans upset at being unexpectedly held back at the Valley Police action ‚Äòuncomfortably like that from past decades‚Äô The Metropolitan police has commissioned an independent investigation after receiving complaints about its treatment of Chelsea supporters after the west London club‚Äôs FA Cup tie at Charlton last Saturday. The Chelsea Supporters‚Äô Trust (CST) called for action earlier this week after writing to the force to voice concerns regarding an operation in which approximately 3,000 travelling fans were held back outside the Valley without prior notice following the conclusion of a game that kicked off at 8pm in freezing temperatures.
